--- In junit@y..., "vicki_nitchiporouk" <vicki_nitchiporouk@y...> 
wrote:
> It seems that I solved this problem by inserting numbers in the 
test 
> methods' names, i.e test1Register, test2Unregister, test3LogOut, 
and 
> so on. When I run my junit suite as a regular console program the 
> order of test methods is observed, but when I run JUnit suite from 
> ant test order is reversed. Any idea how can I force a proper 
order 
> of test method execution while running junit from ant?
> Thanks very much for help!

Your tests will be more valuable if you design them to be order-
independent. You may have to change the domain design also, but you 
will most likely be pleased with the results.

Kent
